1.3.2: Handle redirection of requests based on response status and meta-refresh html tag
1.5.1:
def test_request_meta_handling(self):
        url = 'http://www.example.com/301'
        url2 = 'http://www.example.com/redirected'
        def _test_passthrough(req):
            rsp = Response(url, headers={'Location': url2}, status=301, request=req)
            r = self.mw.process_response(req, rsp, self.spider)
            self.assertIs(r, rsp)
        _test_passthrough(Request(url, meta={'handle_httpstatus_list':
                                                           [404, 301, 302]}))
        _test_passthrough(Request(url, meta={'handle_httpstatus_all': True}))

3.1.2:
Inspired by #1334

I have decided not to include the HTTPERROR_ALLOWED_CODES setting, as, unlike the handle_httpstatus_list Spider attribute, the name of that setting implies that it is directly tied to the HttpErrorMiddleware.
